events.description: The release of Tunisia's inflation data for January 2025, showing a decrease to 4.8%.

facts.fact_text: Tunisia's inflation rate fell to 4.8% in January 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Tunisia's inflation rate edged down to 4.8% in January 2025

facts.fact_text: The 4.8% inflation rate is the lowest recorded since March 2021.
The Consumer Price Index (CPI) increased by 0.3% on a monthly basis in January.

evidences.evidence_text: On a monthly basis, the CPI rose by 0.3% in January

facts.fact_text: Food and non-alcoholic beverage price increases slowed to 5.9% from 6.1% in December.

evidences.evidence_text: softer increases in prices of food & non-alcoholic beverages (5.9% vs 6.1% in December)

claims.claim_text: The overall slowdown in inflation was primarily caused by softer price increases across multiple sectors including food, health, and transportation.

evidences.evidence_text: The slowdown in inflation was mainly due to softer increases in prices of food & non-alcoholic beverages (5.9% vs 6.1% in December); restaurants & hotels (5.5% vs 6%); miscellaneous goods & services (5.6% vs 5.8%); health (3% vs 3.7%) and transportation (2.6% vs 2.8%).

evidence.evidence_text: The slowdown in inflation was mainly due to softer increases in prices of food & non-alcoholic beverages
The slowdown in inflation was mainly due to softer increases in prices of ... transportation (2.6% vs 2.8%)
The slowdown in inflation was mainly due to softer increases in prices of ... health (3% vs 3.7%)
